vulnerabilities.title: OS Security Patch Assessment Not Available
vulnerabilities.synopsis: OS Security Patch Assessment is not available.
vulnerabilities.description:
OS Security Patch Assessment is not available on the remote host.
This does not necessarily indicate a problem with the scan.
Credentials may not have been provided, OS security patch assessment may not be supported for the target, the target may not have been identified, or another issue may have occurred that prevented OS security patch assessment from being available. See plugin output for details.

This plugin reports non-failure information impacting the availability of OS Security Patch Assessment. Failure information is reported by plugin 21745 : 'OS Security Patch Assessment failed'.  If a target host is not supported for OS Security Patch Assessment, plugin 110695 : 'OS Security Patch Assessment Checks Not Supported' will report concurrently with this plugin.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Patch Report
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is missing several patches.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host is missing one or more security patches. This plugin lists the newest version of each patch to install to make sure the remote host is up-to-date.

Note: Because the 'Show missing patches that have been superseded' setting in your scan policy depends on this plugin, it will always run and cannot be disabled.
vulnerabilities.solution: Install the patches listed below.

vulnerabilities.title: Target Credential Status by Authentication Protocol - No Credentials Provided
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Nessus was able to find common ports used for local checks, however, no credentials were provided in the scan policy.
vulnerabilities.description:
Nessus was not able to successfully authenticate directly to the remote target on an available authentication protocol. Nessus was able to connect to the remote port and identify that the service running on the port supports an authentication protocol, but Nessus failed to authenticate to the remote service using the provided credentials. There may have been a protocol failure that prevented authentication from being attempted or all of the provided credentials for the authentication protocol may be invalid. See plugin output for error details.

Please note the following :

- This plugin reports per protocol, so it is possible for   valid credentials to be provided for one protocol and not   another. For example, authentication may succeed via SSH   but fail via SMB, while no credentials were provided for   an available SNMP service.

- Providing valid credentials for all available   authentication protocols may improve scan coverage, but   the value of successful authentication for a given   protocol may vary from target to target depending upon   what data (if any) is gathered from the target via that   protocol. For example, successful authentication via SSH   is more valuable for Linux targets than for Windows   targets, and likewise successful authentication via SMB   is more valuable for Windows targets than for Linux   targets.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Common Platform Enumeration (CPE)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to enumerate CPE names that matched on the remote system.
vulnerabilities.description:
By using information obtained from a Nessus scan, this plugin reports CPE (Common Platform Enumeration) matches for various hardware and software products found on a host. 

Note that if an official CPE is not available for the product, this plugin computes the best possible CPE based on the information available from the scan.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Backported Security Patch Detection (SSH)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Security patches are backported.
vulnerabilities.description:
Security patches may have been 'backported' to the remote SSH server without changing its version number. 

Banner-based checks have been disabled to avoid false positives. 

Note that this test is informational only and does not denote any security problem.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle WebLogic Server 10.3.6.0 / 12.1.3.0 / 12.2.1.3 Java Object Deserialization RCE (CVE-2018-3191)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An application server installed on the remote host is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.description: The version of Oracle WebLogic Server installed on the remote host is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability in the WLS Core Components subcomponent due to unsafe deserialization of Java objects by the RMI registry. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this, via a crafted serialized Java object, to execute arbitrary code.
vulnerabilities.solution: Apply the appropriate patch according to the October 2018 Oracle Critical Patch Update advisory.

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle WebLogic Server Java Object Deserialization RCE (CVE-2018-3245)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An application server installed on the remote host is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.description: The version of Oracle WebLogic Server installed on the remote host is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability in the WLS Core Components subcomponent due to unsafe deserialization of Java objects by the RMI registry. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this, via a crafted serialized Java object, to execute arbitrary code.
vulnerabilities.solution: Apply the appropriate patch according to the October 2018 Oracle Critical Patch Update advisory or upgrade to a supported version for which a patch is available.

vulnerabilities.title: Device Type
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to guess the remote device type.
vulnerabilities.description: Based on the remote operating system, it is possible to determine what the remote system type is (eg: a printer, router, general-purpose computer, etc).
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: NFS Shares World Readable
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote NFS server exports world-readable shares.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote NFS server is exporting one or more shares without restricting access (based on hostname, IP, or IP range).
vulnerabilities.solution: Place the appropriate restrictions on all NFS shares.

vulnerabilities.title: OS Fingerprints Detected
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Multiple OS fingerprints were detected.
vulnerabilities.description: Using a combination of remote probes (TCP/IP, SMB, HTTP, NTP, SNMP, etc), it was possible to gather one or more fingerprints from the remote system. While the highest-confidence result was reported in plugin 11936, “OS Identification”, the complete set of fingerprints detected are reported here.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: OS Identification
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to guess the remote operating system.
vulnerabilities.description: Using a combination of remote probes (e.g., TCP/IP, SMB, HTTP, NTP, SNMP, etc.), it is possible to guess the name of the remote operating system in use. It is also possible sometimes to guess the version of the operating system.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle WebLogic Unsupported Version Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is running an unsupported version of a WebLogic server.
vulnerabilities.description:
According to its version, the installation of Oracle WebLogic running on the remote host is no longer supported per:

- Error Correction Support Dates for Oracle WebLogic Server (Doc ID 950131.1)

Lack of support implies that no new security patches for the product will be released by the vendor. As a result, it is likely to contain security vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities.solution: Upgrade to a version of Oracle WebLogic that is currently supported.

vulnerabilities.title: Traceroute Information
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to obtain traceroute information.
vulnerabilities.description: Makes a traceroute to the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: TCP/IP Timestamps Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service implements TCP timestamps.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host implements TCP timestamps, as defined by RFC1323.  A side effect of this feature is that the uptime of the remote host can sometimes be computed.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: ICMP Timestamp Request Remote Date Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to determine the exact time set on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host answers to an ICMP timestamp request.  This allows an attacker to know the date that is set on the targeted machine, which may assist an unauthenticated, remote attacker in defeating time-based authentication protocols.

Timestamps returned from machines running Windows Vista / 7 / 2008 / 2008 R2 are deliberately incorrect, but usually within 1000 seconds of the actual system time.
vulnerabilities.solution: Filter out the ICMP timestamp requests (13), and the outgoing ICMP timestamp replies (14).

vulnerabilities.title: Host Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) Resolution
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to resolve the name of the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus was able to resolve the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSH Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An OpenSSH-based SSH server was detected on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: An OpenSSH-based SSH server was detected on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Password Authentication Accepted
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The SSH server on the remote host accepts password authentication.
vulnerabilities.description: The SSH server on the remote host accepts password authentication.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Protocol Versions Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A SSH server is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin determines the versions of the SSH protocol supported by the remote SSH daemon.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Server CBC Mode Ciphers Enabled
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The SSH server is configured to use Cipher Block Chaining.
vulnerabilities.description:
The SSH server is configured to support Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) encryption.  This may allow an attacker to recover the plaintext message from the ciphertext. 

Note that this plugin only checks for the options of the SSH server and does not check for vulnerable software versions.
vulnerabilities.solution: Contact the vendor or consult product documentation to disable CBC mode cipher encryption, and enable CTR or GCM cipher mode encryption.

vulnerabilities.title: SSH SHA-1 HMAC Algorithms Enabled
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote SSH server is configured to enable SHA-1 HMAC algorithms.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote SSH server is configured to enable SHA-1 HMAC algorithms.

Although NIST has formally deprecated use of SHA-1 for digital signatures, SHA-1 is still considered secure for HMAC as the security of HMAC does not rely on the underlying hash function being resistant to collisions.

Note that this plugin only checks for the options of the remote SSH server.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Terrapin Prefix Truncation Weakness (CVE-2023-48795)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote SSH server is vulnerable to a mitm prefix truncation attack.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote SSH server is vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle prefix truncation weakness known as Terrapin. This can allow a remote, man-in-the-middle attacker to bypass integrity checks and downgrade the connection's security.

Note that this plugin only checks for remote SSH servers that support either ChaCha20-Poly1305 or CBC with Encrypt-then-MAC and do not support the strict key exchange countermeasures. It does not check for vulnerable software versions.
vulnerabilities.solution: Contact the vendor for an update with the strict key exchange countermeasures or disable the affected algorithms.

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Weak Key Exchange Algorithms Enabled
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote SSH server is configured to allow weak key exchange algorithms.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote SSH server is configured to allow key exchange algorithms which are considered weak.

This is based on the IETF draft document Key Exchange (KEX) Method Updates and Recommendations for Secure Shell (SSH) RFC9142. Section 4 lists guidance on key exchange algorithms that SHOULD NOT and MUST NOT be enabled. This includes:

  diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1

  diffie-hellman-group1-sha1

  gss-gex-sha1-*

  gss-group1-sha1-*

  gss-group14-sha1-*

  rsa1024-sha1

Note that this plugin only checks for the options of the SSH server, and it does not check for vulnerable software versions.
vulnerabilities.solution: Contact the vendor or consult product documentation to disable the weak algorithms.

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Algorithms and Languages Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An SSH server is listening on this port.
vulnerabilities.description: This script detects which algorithms and languages are supported by the remote service for encrypting communications.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSH Server Type and Version Information
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An SSH server is listening on this port.
vulnerabilities.description: It is possible to obtain information about the remote SSH server by sending an empty authentication request.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: RPC portmapper (TCP)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An ONC RPC portmapper is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
The RPC portmapper is running on this port. 

The portmapper allows someone to get the port number of each RPC service running on the remote host by sending either multiple lookup requests or a DUMP request.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: NFS Exported Share Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to access NFS shares on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
At least one of the NFS shares exported by the remote server could be mounted by the scanning host.  An attacker may be able to leverage this to read (and possibly write) files on remote host.

Note: Shares protected by an ACL that includes the IP of the Nessus host will not be tested.
vulnerabilities.solution: Configure NFS on the remote host so that only authorized hosts can mount its remote shares.

vulnerabilities.title: NFS Share Export List
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote NFS server exports a list of shares.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin retrieves the list of NFS exported shares.
vulnerabilities.solution: Ensure each share is intended to be exported.

vulnerabilities.title: HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) Information
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Some information about the remote HTTP configuration can be extracted.
vulnerabilities.description:
This test gives some information about the remote HTTP protocol - the version used, whether HTTP Keep-Alive is enabled, etc... 

This test is informational only and does not denote any security problem.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle WebLogic Detection (Combined)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Oracle WebLogic is running on the remote web server.
vulnerabilities.description: Oracle (formerly BEA) WebLogic, a Java EE application server, is running on the remote web server.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle WebLogic T3 Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A server that understands T3 was detected on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running the WebLogic t3 Protocol.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Service Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service could be identified.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus was able to identify the remote service by its banner or by looking at the error message it sends when it receives an HTTP request.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: RPC Services Enumeration
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An ONC RPC service is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: By sending a DUMP request to the portmapper, it was possible to enumerate the ONC RPC services running on the remote port.  Using this information, it is possible to connect and bind to each service by sending an RPC request to the remote port.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: RPC portmapper Service Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An ONC RPC portmapper is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
The RPC portmapper is running on this port.

The portmapper allows someone to get the port number of each RPC service running on the remote host by sending either multiple lookup requests or a DUMP request.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: HSTS Missing From HTTPS Server (RFC 6797)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server is not enforcing HSTS, as defined by RFC 6797.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote web server is not enforcing HSTS, as defined by RFC 6797. HSTS is an optional response header that can be configured on the server to instruct the browser to only communicate via HTTPS. The lack of HSTS allows downgrade attacks, SSL-stripping man-in-the-middle attacks, and weakens cookie-hijacking protections.
vulnerabilities.solution: Configure the remote web server to use HSTS.

vulnerabilities.title: HSTS Missing From HTTPS Server
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server is not enforcing HSTS.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote HTTPS server is not enforcing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). HSTS is an optional response header that can be configured on the server to instruct the browser to only communicate via HTTPS. The lack of HSTS allows downgrade attacks, SSL-stripping man-in-the-middle attacks, and weakens cookie-hijacking protections.
vulnerabilities.solution: Configure the remote web server to use HSTS.

vulnerabilities.title: Terminal Services Doesn't Use Network Level Authentication (NLA) Only
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Terminal Services doesn't use Network Level Authentication only.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote Terminal Services is not configured to use Network Level Authentication (NLA) only. NLA uses the Credential Security Support Provider (CredSSP) protocol to perform strong server authentication either through TLS/SSL or Kerberos mechanisms, which protect against man-in-the-middle attacks. In addition to improving authentication, NLA also helps protect the remote computer from malicious users and software by completing user authentication before a full RDP connection is established.
vulnerabilities.solution: Enable Network Level Authentication (NLA) on the remote RDP server. This is generally done on the 'Remote' tab of the 'System' settings on Windows.

vulnerabilities.title: Unsupported Windows OS (remote)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote OS or service pack is no longer supported.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote version of Microsoft Windows is either missing a service pack or is no longer supported. As a result, it is likely to contain security vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities.solution: Upgrade to a supported service pack or operating system

vulnerabilities.title: Additional DNS Hostnames
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Nessus has detected potential virtual hosts.
vulnerabilities.description:
Hostnames different from the current hostname have been collected by miscellaneous plugins. Nessus has generated a list of hostnames that point to the remote host. Note that these are only the alternate hostnames for vhosts discovered on a web server.

Different web servers may be hosted on name-based virtual hosts.
vulnerabilities.solution:
If you want to test them, re-scan using the special vhost syntax, such as :

www.example.com[192.0.32.10]

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Self-Signed Certificate
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The SSL certificate chain for this service ends in an unrecognized self-signed certificate.
vulnerabilities.description:
The X.509 certificate chain for this service is not signed by a recognized certificate authority.  If the remote host is a public host in production, this nullifies the use of SSL as anyone could establish a man-in-the-middle attack against the remote host. 

Note that this plugin does not check for certificate chains that end in a certificate that is not self-signed, but is signed by an unrecognized certificate authority.
vulnerabilities.solution: Purchase or generate a proper SSL certificate for this service.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Signed Using SHA-1 Algorithm
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An SSL certificate in the certificate chain has been signed using the SHA-1 hashing algorithm.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote service uses an SSL certificate chain that has been signed with SHA-1, a cryptographically weak hashing algorithm. This signature algorithm is known to be vulnerable to collision attacks. An attacker can potentially exploit this to generate another certificate with the same digital signature, allowing the attacker to masquerade as the affected service.

Note that this plugin reports all SSL certificate chains signed with SHA-1 that expire on or between January 1, 2016 and December 31, 2016 as informational. This is in accordance with Google's gradual sunsetting of the SHA-1 cryptographic hash algorithm.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Cannot Be Trusted
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The SSL certificate for this service cannot be trusted.
vulnerabilities.description:
The server's X.509 certificate cannot be trusted. This situation can occur in three different ways, in which the chain of trust can be broken, as stated below :

  - First, the top of the certificate chain sent by the     server might not be descended from a known public     certificate authority. This can occur either when the     top of the chain is an unrecognized, self-signed     certificate, or when intermediate certificates are     missing that would connect the top of the certificate     chain to a known public certificate authority.

  - Second, the certificate chain may contain a certificate     that is not valid at the time of the scan. This can     occur either when the scan occurs before one of the     certificate's 'notBefore' dates, or after one of the     certificate's 'notAfter' dates.

  - Third, the certificate chain may contain a signature     that either didn't match the certificate's information     or could not be verified. Bad signatures can be fixed by     getting the certificate with the bad signature to be     re-signed by its issuer. Signatures that could not be     verified are the result of the certificate's issuer     using a signing algorithm that Nessus either does not     support or does not recognize.

If the remote host is a public host in production, any break in the chain makes it more difficult for users to verify the authenticity and identity of the web server. This could make it easier to carry out man-in-the-middle attacks against the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: Purchase or generate a proper SSL certificate for this service.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Expiry
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote server's SSL certificate has already expired.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin checks expiry dates of certificates associated with SSL- enabled services on the target and reports whether any have already expired.
vulnerabilities.solution: Purchase or generate a new SSL certificate to replace the existing one.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Information
vulnerabilities.synopsis: This plugin displays the SSL certificate.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin connects to every SSL-related port and attempts to extract and dump the X.509 certificate.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Cipher Block Chaining Cipher Suites Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service supports the use of SSL Cipher Block Chaining ciphers, which combine previous blocks with subsequent ones.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host supports the use of SSL ciphers that operate in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode.  These cipher suites offer additional security over Electronic Codebook (ECB) mode, but have the potential to leak information if used improperly.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Version 2 and 3 Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts traffic using a protocol with known weaknesses.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote service accepts connections encrypted using SSL 2.0 and/or SSL 3.0. These versions of SSL are affected by several cryptographic flaws, including:

  - An insecure padding scheme with CBC ciphers.

  - Insecure session renegotiation and resumption schemes.

An attacker can exploit these flaws to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks or to decrypt communications between the affected service and clients.

Although SSL/TLS has a secure means for choosing the highest supported version of the protocol (so that these versions will be used only if the client or server support nothing better), many web browsers implement this in an unsafe way that allows an attacker to downgrade a connection (such as in POODLE). Therefore, it is recommended that these protocols be disabled entirely.

NIST has determined that SSL 3.0 is no longer acceptable for secure communications. As of the date of enforcement found in PCI DSS v3.1, any version of SSL will not meet the PCI SSC's definition of 'strong cryptography'.
vulnerabilities.solution:
Consult the application's documentation to disable SSL 2.0 and 3.0.
Use TLS 1.2 (with approved cipher suites) or higher instead.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL/TLS Diffie-Hellman Modulus <= 1024 Bits (Logjam)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host allows SSL/TLS connections with one or more Diffie-Hellman moduli less than or equal to 1024 bits.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host allows SSL/TLS connections with one or more Diffie-Hellman moduli less than or equal to 1024 bits. Through cryptanalysis, a third party may be able to find the shared secret in a short amount of time (depending on modulus size and attacker resources). This may allow an attacker to recover the plaintext or potentially violate the integrity of connections.
vulnerabilities.solution: Reconfigure the service to use a unique Diffie-Hellman moduli of 2048 bits or greater.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Medium Strength Cipher Suites Supported (SWEET32)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service supports the use of medium strength SSL ciphers.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host supports the use of SSL ciphers that offer medium strength encryption. Nessus regards medium strength as any encryption that uses key lengths at least 64 bits and less than 112 bits, or else that uses the 3DES encryption suite.

Note that it is considerably easier to circumvent medium strength encryption if the attacker is on the same physical network.
vulnerabilities.solution: Reconfigure the affected application if possible to avoid use of medium strength ciphers.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Perfect Forward Secrecy Cipher Suites Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service supports the use of SSL Perfect Forward Secrecy ciphers, which maintain confidentiality even if the key is stolen.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host supports the use of SSL ciphers that offer Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) encryption.  These cipher suites ensure that recorded SSL traffic cannot be broken at a future date if the server's private key is compromised.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSLv3 Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption Vulnerability (POODLE)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to obtain sensitive information from the remote host with SSL/TLS-enabled services.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host is affected by a man-in-the-middle (MitM) information disclosure vulnerability known as POODLE. The vulnerability is due to the way SSL 3.0 handles padding bytes when decrypting messages encrypted using block ciphers in cipher block chaining (CBC) mode.
MitM attackers can decrypt a selected byte of a cipher text in as few as 256 tries if they are able to force a victim application to repeatedly send the same data over newly created SSL 3.0 connections.

As long as a client and service both support SSLv3, a connection can be 'rolled back' to SSLv3, even if TLSv1 or newer is supported by the client and service.

The TLS Fallback SCSV mechanism prevents 'version rollback' attacks without impacting legacy clients; however, it can only protect connections when the client and service support the mechanism. Sites that cannot disable SSLv3 immediately should enable this mechanism.

This is a vulnerability in the SSLv3 specification, not in any particular SSL implementation. Disabling SSLv3 is the only way to completely mitigate the vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.solution:
Disable SSLv3.

Services that must support SSLv3 should enable the TLS Fallback SCSV mechanism until SSLv3 can be disabled.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL RC4 Cipher Suites Supported (Bar Mitzvah)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service supports the use of the RC4 cipher.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host supports the use of RC4 in one or more cipher suites.
The RC4 cipher is flawed in its generation of a pseudo-random stream of bytes so that a wide variety of small biases are introduced into the stream, decreasing its randomness.

If plaintext is repeatedly encrypted (e.g., HTTP cookies), and an attacker is able to obtain many (i.e., tens of millions) ciphertexts, the attacker may be able to derive the plaintext.
vulnerabilities.solution: Reconfigure the affected application, if possible, to avoid use of RC4 ciphers. Consider using TLS 1.2 with AES-GCM suites subject to browser and web server support.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL/TLS Recommended Cipher Suites
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host advertises discouraged SSL/TLS ciphers.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host has open SSL/TLS ports which advertise discouraged cipher suites. It is recommended to only enable support for the following cipher suites:

TLSv1.3:
  - 0x13,0x01 TLS13_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
  - 0x13,0x02 TLS13_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
  - 0x13,0x03 TLS13_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

TLSv1.2:
  - 0xC0,0x2B ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256
  - 0xC0,0x2F ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256
  - 0xC0,0x2C ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
  - 0xC0,0x30 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
  - 0xCC,0xA9 ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305
  - 0xCC,0xA8 ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305

This is the recommended configuration for the vast majority of services, as it is highly secure and compatible with nearly every client released in the last five (or more) years.
vulnerabilities.solution: Only enable support for recommened cipher suites.

vulnerabilities.title: TLS Version 1.0 Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts traffic using an older version of TLS.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote service accepts connections encrypted using TLS 1.0. TLS 1.0 has a number of cryptographic design flaws. Modern implementations of TLS 1.0 mitigate these problems, but newer versions of TLS like 1.2 and 1.3 are designed against these flaws and should be used whenever possible.

As of March 31, 2020, Endpoints that aren’t enabled for TLS 1.2 and higher will no longer function properly with major web browsers and major vendors.

PCI DSS v3.2 requires that TLS 1.0 be disabled entirely by June 30, 2018, except for POS POI terminals (and the SSL/TLS termination points to which they connect) that can be verified as not being susceptible to any known exploits.
vulnerabilities.solution: Enable support for TLS 1.2 and 1.3, and disable support for TLS 1.0.

vulnerabilities.title: TLS Version 1.1 Deprecated Protocol
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts traffic using an older version of TLS.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote service accepts connections encrypted using TLS 1.1. TLS 1.1 lacks support for current and recommended cipher suites. Ciphers that support encryption before MAC computation, and authenticated encryption modes such as GCM cannot be used with TLS 1.1

As of March 31, 2020, Endpoints that are not enabled for TLS 1.2 and higher will no longer function properly with major web browsers and major vendors.
vulnerabilities.solution: Enable support for TLS 1.2 and/or 1.3, and disable support for TLS 1.1.

vulnerabilities.title: TLS Version 1.2 Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts traffic using a version of TLS.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote service accepts connections encrypted using TLS 1.2.
vulnerabilities.solution: N/A

vulnerabilities.title: TLS Version 1.1 Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts traffic using an older version of TLS.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote service accepts connections encrypted using TLS 1.1.
TLS 1.1 lacks support for current and recommended cipher suites.
Ciphers that support encryption before MAC computation, and authenticated encryption modes such as GCM cannot be used with TLS 1.1

As of March 31, 2020, Endpoints that are not enabled for TLS 1.2 and higher will no longer function properly with major web browsers and major vendors.
vulnerabilities.solution: Enable support for TLS 1.2 and/or 1.3, and disable support for TLS 1.1.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Cipher Suites Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts communications using SSL.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin detects which SSL ciphers are supported by the remote service for encrypting communications.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSL / TLS Versions Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts communications.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin detects which SSL and TLS versions are supported by the remote service for encrypting communications.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows SMB2 and SMB3 Dialects Supported (remote check)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to obtain information about the dialects of SMB2 and SMB3 available on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus was able to obtain the set of SMB2 and SMB3 dialects running on the remote host by sending an authentication request to port 139 or 445.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Network Time Protocol (NTP) Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An NTP server is listening on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: An NTP server is listening on port 123. If not securely configured, it may provide information about its version, current date, current time, and possibly system information.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: NetBIOS Multiple IP Address Enumeration
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is configured with multiple IP addresses.
vulnerabilities.description: By sending a special NetBIOS query, Nessus was able to detect the use of multiple IP addresses on the remote host.  This indicates the host may be running virtualization software, a VPN client, or has multiple network interfaces.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows NTLMSSP Authentication Request Remote Network Name Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to obtain the network name of the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host listens on tcp port 445 and replies to SMB requests.

By sending an NTLMSSP authentication request it is possible to obtain the name of the remote system and the name of its domain.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol Version 1 Enabled (uncredentialed check)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host supports the SMBv1 protocol.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host (Windows and/or Samba server) supports Server Message Block Protocol version 1 (SMBv1). Microsoft recommends that users discontinue the use of SMBv1 due to the lack of security features that were included in later SMB versions. Additionally, most security and compliance agencies recommend that users disable SMBv1 per SMB best practices.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable SMBv1 according to the vendor instructions in Microsoft KB2696547. Additionally, block SMB directly by blocking TCP port 445 on all network boundary devices. For SMB over the NetBIOS API, block TCP ports 137 / 139 and UDP ports 137 / 138 on all network boundary devices.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows SMB Versions Supported (remote check)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to obtain information about the version of SMB running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
Nessus was able to obtain the version of SMB running on the remote host by sending an authentication request to port 139 or 445.

Note that this plugin is a remote check and does not work on agents.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Nessus Windows Scan Not Performed with Admin Privileges
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The Nessus scan of this host may be incomplete due to insufficient privileges provided.
vulnerabilities.description:
The Nessus scanner testing the remote host has been given SMB credentials to log into the remote host, however these credentials do not have administrative privileges. 

Typically, when Nessus performs a patch audit, it logs into the remote host and reads the version of the DLLs on the remote host to determine if a given patch has been applied or not.  This is the method Microsoft recommends to determine if a patch has been applied. 

If your Nessus scanner does not have administrative privileges when doing a scan, then Nessus has to fall back to perform a patch audit through the registry which may lead to false positives (especially when using third-party patch auditing tools) or to false negatives (not all patches can be detected through the registry).
vulnerabilities.solution: Reconfigure your scanner to use credentials with administrative privileges.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows SMB Registry : Nessus Cannot Access the Windows Registry
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Nessus is not able to access the remote Windows Registry.
vulnerabilities.description:
It was not possible to connect to PIPE\winreg on the remote host.

If you intend to use Nessus to perform registry-based checks, the registry checks will not work because the 'Remote Registry Access' service (winreg) has been disabled on the remote host or can not be connected to with the supplied credentials.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: COM+ Internet Services (CIS) Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A COM+ Internet Services (CIS) server is listening on this port.
vulnerabilities.description: COM+ Internet Services are RPC over HTTP tunneling and require IIS to operate.  CIS ports shouldn't be visible on internet but only behind a firewall.
vulnerabilities.solution:
If you do not use this service, disable it with DCOMCNFG. 

Otherwise, limit access to this port.

vulnerabilities.title: WS-Management Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server is used for remote management.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote web server supports the Web Services for Management (WS-Management) specification, a general web services protocol based on SOAP for managing systems, applications, and other such entities.
vulnerabilities.solution: Limit incoming traffic to this port if desired.

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Server Type and Version
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A web server is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin attempts to determine the type and the version of the   remote web server.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Methods Allowed (per directory)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: This plugin determines which HTTP methods are allowed on various CGI directories.
vulnerabilities.description:
By calling the OPTIONS method, it is possible to determine which HTTP methods are allowed on each directory.

The following HTTP methods are considered insecure:
  PUT, DELETE, CONNECT, TRACE, HEAD

Many frameworks and languages treat 'HEAD' as a 'GET' request, albeit one without any body in the response. If a security constraint was set on 'GET' requests such that only 'authenticatedUsers' could access GET requests for a particular servlet or resource, it would be bypassed for the 'HEAD' version. This allowed unauthorized blind submission of any privileged GET request.

As this list may be incomplete, the plugin also tests - if 'Thorough tests' are enabled or 'Enable web applications tests' is set to 'yes' in the scan policy - various known HTTP methods on each directory and considers them as unsupported if it receives a response code of 400, 403, 405, or 501.

Note that the plugin output is only informational and does not necessarily indicate the presence of any security vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Web Server Unconfigured - Default Install Page Present
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server is not configured or is improperly configured.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote web server uses its default welcome page. Therefore, it's probable that this server is not used at all or is serving content that is meant to be hidden.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable this service if you do not use it.

vulnerabilities.title: SMB Signing not required
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Signing is not required on the remote SMB server.
vulnerabilities.description: Signing is not required on the remote SMB server. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks against the SMB server.
vulnerabilities.solution: Enforce message signing in the host's configuration. On Windows, this is found in the policy setting 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)'. On Samba, the setting is called 'server signing'. See the 'see also' links for further details.

vulnerabilities.title: Terminal Services Use SSL/TLS
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Terminal Services use SSL/TLS.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote Terminal Services is configured to use SSL/TLS.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Remote Desktop Protocol Service Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host has an remote desktop protocol service enabled.
vulnerabilities.description:
The Remote Desktop Protocol allows a user to remotely obtain a graphical login (and therefore act as a local user on the remote host).

If an attacker gains a valid login and password, this service could be used to gain further access on the remote host.  An attacker may also use this service to mount a dictionary attack against the remote host to try to log in remotely.

Note that RDP (the Remote Desktop Protocol) is vulnerable to Man-in-the-middle attacks, making it easy for attackers to steal the credentials of legitimate users by impersonating the Windows server.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable the service if you do not use it, and do not allow this service to run across the Internet.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows SMB NativeLanManager Remote System Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to obtain information about the remote operating system.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus was able to obtain the remote operating system name and version (Windows and/or Samba) by sending an authentication request to port 139 or 445. Note that this plugin requires SMB to be enabled on the host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Windows NetBIOS / SMB Remote Host Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It was possible to obtain the network name of the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host is listening on UDP port 137 or TCP port 445, and replies to NetBIOS nbtscan or SMB requests.

Note that this plugin gathers information to be used in other plugins, but does not itself generate a report.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: DCE Services Enumeration
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A DCE/RPC service is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: By sending a Lookup request to the portmapper (TCP 135 or epmapper PIPE) it was possible to enumerate the Distributed Computing Environment (DCE) services running on the remote port. Using this information it is possible to connect and bind to each service by sending an RPC request to the remote port/pipe.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows SMB Service Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A file / print sharing service is listening on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote service understands the CIFS (Common Internet File System) or Server Message Block (SMB) protocol, used to provide shared access to files, printers, etc between nodes on a network.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Remote Desktop Protocol Server Man-in-the-Middle Weakness
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It may be possible to get access to the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote version of the Remote Desktop Protocol Server (Terminal Service) is vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle (MiTM) attack. The RDP client makes no effort to validate the identity of the server when setting up encryption. An attacker with the ability to intercept traffic from the RDP server can establish encryption with the client and server without being detected. A MiTM attack of this nature would allow the attacker to obtain any sensitive information transmitted, including authentication credentials.

This flaw exists because the RDP server stores a publicly known hard-coded RSA private key. Any attacker in a privileged network location can use the key for this attack.
vulnerabilities.solution:
- Force the use of SSL as a transport layer for this service if supported, or/and

- On Microsoft Windows operating systems, select the 'Allow connections only from computers running Remote  Desktop with Network Level Authentication' setting if it is available.

vulnerabilities.title: Terminal Services Encryption Level is not FIPS-140 Compliant
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is not FIPS-140 compliant.
vulnerabilities.description: The encryption setting used by the remote Terminal Services service is not FIPS-140 compliant.
vulnerabilities.solution:
Change RDP encryption level to :

 4. FIPS Compliant

vulnerabilities.title: Terminal Services Encryption Level is Medium or Low
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is using weak cryptography.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote Terminal Services service is not configured to use strong cryptography. 

Using weak cryptography with this service may allow an attacker to eavesdrop on the communications more easily and obtain screenshots and/or keystrokes.
vulnerabilities.solution:
Change RDP encryption level to one of :

 3. High

 4. FIPS Compliant

vulnerabilities.title: JQuery 1.2 < 3.5.0 Multiple XSS
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server is affected by multiple cross site scripting vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.description:
According to the self-reported version in the script, the version of JQuery hosted on the remote web server is greater than or equal to 1.2 and prior to 3.5.0. It is, therefore, affected by multiple cross site scripting vulnerabilities.

Note, the vulnerabilities referenced in this plugin have no security impact on PAN-OS, and/or the scenarios required for successful exploitation do not exist on devices running a PAN-OS release.
vulnerabilities.solution: Upgrade to JQuery version 3.5.0 or later.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft .NET Handlers Enumeration
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to enumerate the remote .NET handlers used by the remote web server.
vulnerabilities.description: It is possible to obtain the list of handlers the remote ASP.NET web server supports.
vulnerabilities.solution: None

vulnerabilities.title: JQuery Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The web server on the remote host uses JQuery.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus was able to detect JQuery on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: RDP Screenshot
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to take a screenshot of the remote login screen.
vulnerabilities.description:
This script attempts to connect to the remote host via RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) and attempts to take a screenshot of the login screen.

While this is not a vulnerability by itself, some versions of Windows display the names of the users who can connect and which ones are connected already.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate with Wrong Hostname
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The SSL certificate for this service is for a different host.
vulnerabilities.description: The 'commonName' (CN) attribute of the SSL certificate presented for this service is for a different machine.
vulnerabilities.solution: Purchase or generate a proper SSL certificate for this service.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate 'commonName' Mismatch
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The 'commonName' (CN) attribute in the SSL certificate does not match the hostname.
vulnerabilities.description: The service running on the remote host presents an SSL certificate for which the 'commonName' (CN) attribute does not match the hostname on which the service listens.
vulnerabilities.solution: If the machine has several names, make sure that users connect to the service through the DNS hostname that matches the common name in the certificate.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Signed Using Weak Hashing Algorithm
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An SSL certificate in the certificate chain has been signed using a weak hash algorithm.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote service uses an SSL certificate chain that has been signed using a cryptographically weak hashing algorithm (e.g. MD2, MD4, MD5, or SHA1). These signature algorithms are known to be vulnerable to collision attacks. An attacker can exploit this to generate another certificate with the same digital signature, allowing an attacker to masquerade as the affected service.

Note that this plugin reports all SSL certificate chains signed with SHA-1 that expire after January 1, 2017 as vulnerable. This is in accordance with Google's gradual sunsetting of the SHA-1 cryptographic hash algorithm.

Note that certificates in the chain that are contained in the Nessus CA database (known_CA.inc) have been ignored.
vulnerabilities.solution: Contact the Certificate Authority to have the SSL certificate reissued.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Session Resume Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host allows resuming SSL sessions.
vulnerabilities.description: This script detects whether a host allows resuming SSL sessions by performing a full SSL handshake to receive a session ID, and then reconnecting with the previously used session ID.  If the server accepts the session ID in the second connection, the server maintains a cache of sessions that can be resumed.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle Database tnslsnr Service Remote Version Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An Oracle tnslsnr service is listening on the remote port.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running the Oracle tnslsnr service, a network interface to Oracle databases.  This product allows a remote user to determine the presence and version number of a given Oracle installation.
vulnerabilities.solution: Filter incoming traffic to this port so that only authorized hosts can connect to it.

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Express (EM Express) Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server hosts a web-based database management system.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote web server hosts Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Express, a web-based tool for managing an Oracle database.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: WebDAV Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote server is running with WebDAV enabled.
vulnerabilities.description:
WebDAV is an industry standard extension to the HTTP specification.
It adds a capability for authorized users to remotely add and manage the content of a web server.

If you do not use this extension, you should disable it.
vulnerabilities.solution: http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?kbid=241520

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Message Queuing Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Microsoft Message Queuing is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: Microsoft Message Queuing is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: PostgreSQL Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A database service is listening on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote service is a PostgreSQL database server, or a derivative such as EnterpriseDB.
vulnerabilities.solution: Limit incoming traffic to this port if desired.

vulnerabilities.title: Service Detection (HELP Request)
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service could be identified.
vulnerabilities.description: It was possible to identify the remote service by its banner or by looking at the error message it sends when it receives a 'HELP' request.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: TLS ALPN Supported Protocol Enumeration
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host supports the TLS ALPN extension.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host supports the TLS ALPN extension. This plugin enumerates the protocols the extension supports.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: TLS NPN Supported Protocol Enumeration
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host supports the TLS NPN extension.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host supports the TLS NPN (Transport Layer Security Next Protocol Negotiation) extension. This plugin enumerates the protocols the extension supports.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service appears to use OpenSSL to encrypt traffic.
vulnerabilities.description:
Based on its response to a TLS request with a specially crafted server name extension, it seems that the remote service is using the OpenSSL library to encrypt traffic.

Note that this plugin can only detect OpenSSL implementations that have enabled support for TLS extensions (RFC 4366).
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: MySQL Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A database server is listening on the remote port.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running MySQL, an open source database server.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Expiry - Future Expiry
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The SSL certificate associated with the remote service will expire soon.
vulnerabilities.description: The SSL certificate associated with the remote service will expire soon.
vulnerabilities.solution: Purchase or generate a new SSL certificate in the near future to replace the existing one.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Certificate Chain Contains Certificates Expiring Soon
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host has an SSL certificate chain with one or more certificates that are going to expire soon.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host has an SSL certificate chain with one or more SSL certificates that are going to expire soon. Failure to renew these certificates before the expiration date may result in denial of service for users.
vulnerabilities.solution: Renew any soon to expire SSL certificates.

vulnerabilities.title: SSL Root Certification Authority Certificate Information
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A root Certification Authority certificate was found at the top of the certificate chain.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote service uses an SSL certificate chain that contains a self-signed root Certification Authority certificate at the top of the chain.
vulnerabilities.solution: Ensure that use of this root Certification Authority certificate complies with your organization's acceptable use and security policies.

vulnerabilities.title: TLS Version 1.3 Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service encrypts traffic using a version of TLS.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote service accepts connections encrypted using TLS 1.3.
vulnerabilities.solution: N/A

vulnerabilities.title: TLS Next Protocols Supported
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service advertises one or more protocols as being supported over TLS.
vulnerabilities.description:
This script detects which protocols are advertised by the remote service to be encapsulated by TLS connections.

Note that Nessus did not attempt to negotiate TLS sessions with the protocols shown.  The remote service may be falsely advertising these protocols and / or failing to advertise other supported protocols.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: DNS Server hostname.bind Map Hostname Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The DNS server discloses the remote host name.
vulnerabilities.description: It is possible to learn the remote host name by querying the remote DNS server for 'hostname.bind' in the CHAOS domain.
vulnerabilities.solution: It may be possible to disable this feature.  Consult the vendor's documentation for more information.

vulnerabilities.title: DNS Server Version Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Nessus was able to obtain version information on the remote DNS server.
vulnerabilities.description:
Nessus was able to obtain version information by sending a special TXT record query to the remote host.

Note that this version is not necessarily accurate and could even be forged, as some DNS servers send the information based on a configuration file.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: DNS Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A DNS server is listening on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote service is a Domain Name System (DNS) server, which provides a mapping between hostnames and IP addresses.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable this service if it is not needed or restrict access to internal hosts only if the service is available externally.

vulnerabilities.title: AMQP Cleartext Authentication
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote host is running a service that allows cleartext authentication.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMQP) service supports one or more authentication mechanisms that allow credentials to be sent in the clear.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable cleartext authentication mechanisms in the AMQP configuration.

vulnerabilities.title: Advanced Message Queuing Protocol Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A messaging service is listening on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running an AMQP server, which provides messaging and queuing services for other applications.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A port mapping service is listening on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running Erlang Port Mapper Daemon, which acts as a name server on all hosts involved in distributed Erlang computations.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: FTP Service AUTH TLS Command Support
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote directory service supports encrypting traffic.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote FTP service supports the use of the 'AUTH TLS' command to switch from a cleartext to an encrypted communications channel.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: FTP Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An FTP server is listening on a remote port.
vulnerabilities.description: It is possible to obtain the banner of the remote FTP server by connecting to a remote port.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: IMAP Service Banner Retrieval
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An IMAP server is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: An IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol) server is installed and running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SMTP Authentication Methods
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote mail server supports authentication.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote SMTP server advertises that it supports authentication.
vulnerabilities.solution: Review the list of methods and whether they're available over an encrypted channel.

vulnerabilities.title: SMTP Service STARTTLS Command Support
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote mail service supports encrypting traffic.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote SMTP service supports the use of the 'STARTTLS' command to switch from a cleartext to an encrypted communications channel.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: SMTP Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: An SMTP server is listening on the remote port.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote host is running a mail (SMTP) server on this port. 

Since SMTP servers are the targets of spammers, it is recommended you disable it if you do not use it.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable this service if you do not use it, or filter incoming traffic to this port.

vulnerabilities.title: nginx HTTP Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The nginx HTTP server was detected on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus was able to detect the nginx HTTP server by looking at the HTTP banner on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Web Server robots.txt Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server contains a 'robots.txt' file.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host contains a file named 'robots.txt' that is intended to prevent web 'robots' from visiting certain directories in a website for maintenance or indexing purposes.  A malicious user may also be able to use the contents of this file to learn of sensitive documents or directories on the affected site and either retrieve them directly or target them for other attacks.
vulnerabilities.solution: Review the contents of the site's robots.txt file, use Robots META tags instead of entries in the robots.txt file, and/or adjust the web server's access controls to limit access to sensitive material.

vulnerabilities.title: Web Server No 404 Error Code Check
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server does not return 404 error codes.
vulnerabilities.description:
The remote web server is configured such that it does not return '404 Not Found' error codes when a nonexistent file is requested, perhaps returning instead a site map, search page or authentication page.

Nessus has enabled some counter measures for this.  However, they might be insufficient.  If a great number of security holes are produced for this port, they might not all be accurate.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: POP Server Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A POP server is listening on the remote port.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running a server that understands the Post Office Protocol (POP), used by email clients to retrieve messages from a server, possibly across a network link.
vulnerabilities.solution: Disable this service if you do not use it.

vulnerabilities.title: IMAP Service STARTTLS Command Support
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote mail service supports encrypting traffic.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote IMAP service supports the use of the 'STARTTLS' command to switch from a cleartext to an encrypted communications channel.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: POP3 Service STLS Command Support
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote mail service supports encrypting traffic.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote POP3 service supports the use of the 'STLS' command to switch from a cleartext to an encrypted communications channel.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Ethernet Card Manufacturer Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The manufacturer can be identified from the Ethernet OUI.
vulnerabilities.description: Each ethernet MAC address starts with a 24-bit Organizationally Unique Identifier (OUI). These OUIs are registered by IEEE.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Ethernet MAC Addresses
vulnerabilities.synopsis: This plugin gathers MAC addresses from various sources and consolidates them into a list.
vulnerabilities.description: This plugin gathers MAC addresses discovered from both remote probing of the host (e.g. SNMP and Netbios) and from running local checks (e.g. ifconfig). It then consolidates the MAC addresses into a single, unique, and uniform list.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Apache 2.4.x < 2.4.64 Multiple Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote web server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities.description:
The version of Apache httpd installed on the remote host is prior to 2.4.64. It is, therefore, affected by multiple vulnerabilities as referenced in the 2.4.64 advisory.

  - In certain proxy configurations, a denial of service attack against Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.26     through to 2.4.63 can be triggered by untrusted clients causing an assertion in mod_proxy_http2.
    Configurations affected are a reverse proxy is configured for an HTTP/2 backend, with ProxyPreserveHost     set to on. (CVE-2025-49630)

  - HTTP response splitting in the core of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker who can manipulate the     Content-Type response headers of applications hosted or proxied by the server can split the HTTP response.
    This vulnerability was described as CVE-2023-38709 but the patch included in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 did     not address the issue. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.64, which fixes this issue.
    (CVE-2024-42516)

  - SSRF in Apache HTTP Server with mod_proxy loaded allows an attacker to send outbound proxy requests to a     URL controlled by the attacker. Requires an unlikely configuration where mod_headers is configured to     modify the Content-Type request or response header with a value provided in the HTTP request. Users are     recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.64 which fixes this issue. (CVE-2024-43204)

  - Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in Apache HTTP Server on Windows allows to potentially leak NTLM hashes     to a malicious server via mod_rewrite or apache expressions that pass unvalidated request input. This     issue affects Apache HTTP Server: from 2.4.0 through 2.4.63. Note: The Apache HTTP Server Project will be     setting a higher bar for accepting vulnerability reports regarding SSRF via UNC paths. The server offers     limited protection against administrators directing the server to open UNC paths. Windows servers should     limit the hosts they will connect over via SMB based on the nature of NTLM authentication.
    (CVE-2024-43394)

  - Insufficient escaping of user-supplied data in mod_ssl in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.63 and earlier allows an     untrusted SSL/TLS client to insert escape characters into log files in some configurations. In a logging     configuration where CustomLog is used with %{varname}x or %{varname}c to log variables provided by     mod_ssl such as SSL_TLS_SNI, no escaping is performed by either mod_log_config or mod_ssl and unsanitized     data provided by the client may appear in log files. (CVE-2024-47252)

Note that Nessus has not tested for these issues but has instead relied only on the application's self-reported version number.
vulnerabilities.solution: Upgrade to Apache version 2.4.64 or later.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft SQL Server UDP Query Remote Version Disclosure
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to determine the remote SQL server version.
vulnerabilities.description:
Microsoft SQL server has a function wherein remote users can query the database server for the version that is being run.  The query takes place over the same UDP port that handles the mapping of multiple SQL server instances on the same machine. 

It is important to note that, after Version 8.00.194, Microsoft decided not to update this function.  This means that the data returned by the SQL ping is inaccurate for newer releases of SQL Server.
vulnerabilities.solution: If there is only a single SQL instance installed on the remote host, consider filter incoming traffic to this port.

vulnerabilities.title: Apache HTTP Server Version
vulnerabilities.synopsis: It is possible to obtain the version number of the remote Apache HTTP server.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running the Apache HTTP Server, an open source web server. It was possible to read the version number from the banner.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: VERITAS Backup Agent Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A backup agent is running on the remote host.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running a Backup Agent that uses the Network Data Management Protocol (NDMP).
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft SQL Server STARTTLS Support
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote service supports encrypting traffic.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote Microsoft SQL Server service supports the use of encryption initiated during pre-login to switch from a cleartext to an encrypted communications channel.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: MSSQL Host Information in NTLM SSP
vulnerabilities.synopsis: Nessus can obtain information about the host by examining the NTLM SSP message.
vulnerabilities.description: Nessus can obtain information about the host by examining the NTLM SSP challenge issued during NTLM authentication, over MSSQL.
vulnerabilities.solution: n/a

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft SQL Server TCP/IP Listener Detection
vulnerabilities.synopsis: A database server is listening on the remote port.
vulnerabilities.description: The remote host is running MSSQL, a database server from Microsoft. It is possible to extract the version number of the remote installation from the server pre-login response.
vulnerabilities.solution: Restrict access to the database to allowed IPs only.

vulnerabilities.title: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 < 9.0.104 multiple vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Apache Tomcat server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description:
The version of Tomcat installed on the remote host is prior to 9.0.104. It is, therefore, affected by multiple vulnerabilities as referenced in the fixed_in_apache_tomcat_9.0.104_security-9 advisory.

- Improper Neutralization of Escape, Meta, or Control Sequences vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. For a subset     of unlikely rewrite rule configurations, it was possible for a specially crafted request to bypass some     rewrite rules. If those rewrite rules effectively enforced security constraints, those constraints could     be bypassed. This issue affects Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.5, from 10.1.0-M1 through     10.1.39, from 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.102. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 9.0.104, which     fixes the issue. (CVE-2025-31651)

Note that Nessus has not tested for these issues but has instead relied only on the application's self-reported version number.
vulnerabilities.solution: Upgrade to Apache Tomcat version 9.0.104 or later.

vulnerabilities.title: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 < 9.0.106 multiple vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.synopsis: The remote Apache Tomcat server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description:
The version of Tomcat installed on the remote host is prior to 9.0.106. It is, therefore, affected by multiple vulnerabilities as referenced in the fixed_in_apache_tomcat_9.0.106_security-9 advisory.

  - Untrusted Search Path vulnerability in Apache Tomcat installer for Windows. During installation, the     Tomcat installer for Windows used icacls.exe without specifying a full path. This issue affects Apache     Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.7, from 10.1.0 through 10.1.41, from 9.0.23 through 9.0.105. The     following versions were EOL at the time the CVE was created but are known to be affected: 8.5.0 through     8.5.100 and 7.0.95 through 7.0.109. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 11.0.8, 10.1.42 or     9.0.106, which fix the issue. (CVE-2025-49124)

  - Session Fixation vulnerability in Apache Tomcat via rewrite valve. This issue affects Apache Tomcat: from     11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.7, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.41, from 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.105. Older, EOL     versions may also be affected. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 11.0.8, 10.1.42 or 9.0.106,     which fix the issue. (CVE-2025-55668)

  - Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. When using     PreResources or PostResources mounted other than at the root of the web application, it was possible to     access those resources via an unexpected path. That path was likely not to be protected by the same     security constraints as the expected path, allowing those security constraints to be bypassed. This issue     affects Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.7, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.41, from 9.0.0.M1     through 9.0.105. The following versions were EOL at the time the CVE was created but are known to be     affected: 8.5.0 through 8.5.100. Other, older, EOL versions may also be affected. Users are recommended to     upgrade to version 11.0.8, 10.1.42 or 9.0.106, which fix the issue. (CVE-2025-49125)

  - Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. This issue affects     Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.7, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.41, from 9.0.0.M1 through     9.0.105. The following versions were EOL at the time the CVE was created but are known to be affected:
    8.5.0 though 8.5.100. Other, older, EOL versions may also be affected. Users are recommended to upgrade to     version 11.0.8, 10.1.42 or 9.0.106, which fix the issue. (CVE-2025-48988)

  - Allocation of resources for multipart headers with insufficient limits enabled a DoS vulnerability in     Apache Commons FileUpload. This issue affects Apache Commons FileUpload: from 1.0 before 1.6; from     2.0.0-M1 before 2.0.0-M4. Users are recommended to upgrade to versions 1.6 or 2.0.0-M4, which fix the     issue. (CVE-2025-48976)

Note that Nessus has not tested for these issues but has instead relied only on the application's self-reported version number.
vulnerabilities.solution: Upgrade to Apache Tomcat version 9.0.106 or later.

vulnerabilities.title: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 < 9.0.108

vulnerabilities.description:

vulnerabilities.description:

This issue affects Apache Tomcat: from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.6, from 10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.40,     from 9.0.0.M1 through 9.0.104. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 11.0.7, 10.1.41 or 9.0.105,     which fixes the issue. (CVE-2025-46701)
